FUTURAMA
Episode 409
FUTURE STOCK
Aaron Ehasz Dave, The Neutral Planet
xml.info: Opening Credits. Caption: Love It Or Shove It.
Lodgatorium Comfort Dome Inn: Corridor. A man attatches a "5" to a sign reading "Planet Express tockholders Meeting" so the third word reads "5tockholders."
xml.speak: Yes, good thing I noticed the similar shapes.
xml.info: Cut to: Lodgatorium Comfort Dome Inn: Ballroom A. Hermes hosts the stockholders meeting. Present are the Planet Express crew and Hattie.
The curtain opens and he pushes him forward.
xml.speak: Ohh!
xml.info: The stockholders cheer.
xml.speak: There he is!
(SHOUTING) Take it off!
Where am I?
Move forward. Walk into the light.

Oh God! I'm dead. Well, no matter. (reading) Thank you all for coming. I don't recognise any of you, nor can I recall why I am here. Now without further ado, a film highlighting Planet Express Inc.'s latest fiscal year.
xml.info: The stockholders applaud and a film comes on showing the Planet Express ship flying over some water away from a sunset.
xml.speak: IN FILM Planet Express is on the move. For this young, hip delivery compnay, tomorrow is today and today is yesterday. You heard me. It was a year of soaring profits and significant one time losses.
xml.info: The ship takes off from Amazonia and immediately crashes.
xml.speak: I'll not only help you find it, I'll help you do more to it!
xml.info: Lodgatorium Comfort Dome Inn: Corridor. Fry and Zoidberg walk out of Ballroom A and Fry sees a sign outside Ballroom B.
xml.speak: Ooo, a bot-mitzvah. Shalom hunger, shalom free food!
xml.info: He walks in and Zoidberg follows. A robot blocks Zoidberg's path.
xml.speak: No shellfish!
xml.info: He slams the door.
xml.speak: That is so unfair!
Tell me about it.
xml.info: Cut to: Lodgatorium Comfort Dome Inn: Ballroom B. The Jewbots dance around the bot-mitvah bot and Fry gets some food from the buffet.
xml.speak: So what's the deal? You guys don't believe in Robot Jesus?
We believe he was built and that he was a very well programmed robot but he wasn't our Messiah.
xml.info: Cut to: Lodgatorium Comfort Dome Inn: Ballroom A. The film is still going on. The Planet Express ship soars into space with fireworks trailing behind it.
xml.speak: IN FILM And so our company flames onwards. Planet Express: Limitless potential, boundless horizons, the unstoppable juggernaut of the corporate universe.
xml.info: The Planet Express ship passes through a ring and forms the company logo. The film ends.
xml.speak: It's been a terrible year people. The company is on the verge of bankruptcy.
xml.info: The stockholders gasp.
xml.speak: But the movie -
Was a substantial loss for the company. The blue slice represent s the money we earned from shipping packages while the green slice represents an $8 bank error in our favour.
This toads the wet sprocket. What about our thousands of shares of stock?
Worthless.
xml.info: The stockholders gasp.
xml.speak: (SHOUTING) I'll kill you!
I own one share of Planet kajiggers so I'm entitled to some answers. Question 1: Why does no one visit me in my home?
'Cause your apartment smells like Polygrip and cat pee.
xml.info: Lodgatorium Comfort Dome Inn: Corridor. Fry sees a sign outside Ballroom C for a cryogenic support group. He gasps.
xml.speak: This is perfect for me.
xml.info: He was actually looking at the free food sign underneath. Zoidberg follows him in.
xml.speak: Question: Do you have to have been cryogenically frozen to get the free - You didn't let me finish. I was going to say "to get the free food."
xml.info: Cut to: Lodgatorium Comfort Dome Inn: Ballroom C. Fry gobbles down the food at the buffet while the support group discusses things.
xml.speak: My name's Joe and I'm a defrostee.
Hello Joe.
When I was frozen giant carrots ruled the Earth. But now they don't. It takes some getting used to.
xml.info: He sits down and the group applauds. Fry has sat down with a plate of food. Another man stands up.
xml.speak: Back in the 1980's I was the toast of Wall Street. I was having whiskey with Boesky and cookies with Milken. But then, I was diagnosed with terminal boneitis.
Boneitis? Pft! That's a funny name for a horrible disease.

There was no cure at the time. One drug company was close but I arranged a hostile takeover and sold off all the assets. Made a cool hundred mil. Naturally I froze myself until a cure was found. Now here I am, ready to sleaze my way back to the top, 80's style!
xml.info: He sits down next to Fry.
xml.speak: As a caveman frozen in a glacier I face different challenges. (crying) The hardest thign was seeing my wife on display in the British Museum.
xml.info: The group murmurs.
xml.speak: Sure do! We can dance!
xml.info: He hums the Safety Dance tune and they both laugh.
xml.speak: Y'know that dance wasn't as safe as they said it was.
I tell you, two go-go 80's Reganauts like us, we could rule this world!
No question.
If only someone would give us a shot.
They're scared of our raw power. Oh but if you want a job, I could beg everyone at the company where I work.
Awesome. Awesome to the max!
xml.info: Lodgatorium Comfort Dome Inn: Ballroom A. Enter Fry and That Guy.
xml.speak: And finally, the post office meter is for business mail only.
Aw come on! I got a lot of ransom notes to send!
Enough talk. It's time for action. I move that everyone come to my apartment to snuggle my cat.
Second.
I move that your cat stinks and is ugly.
Second.
I move that we vote on a new Chief Executive Officer and oust this old creep. And also that make cat smells good and is pretty.
xml.info: Scruffy thinks.
xml.speak: Second.
Very well. I nominate the Professor.
Second.
Second.
Second.
I'm your man.
I vote my 10,000 shares for the Professor.
Yeah the Professor!
Me!
xml.info: Hermes writes 50,000 on a chart for Farnsworth.
xml.speak: I nominate That Guy. Not just because he has a suit but because he knows about business and stuff and he has a tie. My shares still count if they went through the washing machine right?
xml.info: Hermes starts a new chart for That Guy next to Farnsworth's and write 10,000 under his name.
xml.speak: Well, if I know anything about which number is bigger than the other number, I'd say that -
Hold on there. Scruffy votes his 40,000 shares for the mysterious stranger.
40,000? How come you have four times as much stock as the rest of us?
Scruffy believes in this company.
xml.info: He sniffs and wipes away a tear. Hermes changes That Guy's score to 50,000.
xml.speak: Then we have a tie. And in the event of a tie the Professor, as the current CEO remains -
I demand the floor. I may only have one share but I get to vote same as anyone. And I'm voting against the cat hater. Isn't that right kitty? Hey! You ate my change!
xml.info: She shakes the cat and the money inside it jingles. Hermes changes That Guy's score to 50,001.
xml.speak: Then it's settled. The new chief executive officer of Planet Express corporation is That Guy.
xml.info: That Guy hums Safety Dance.
Planet Express: Meeting Room.
xml.speak: Please welcome our new chief executive officer, That Guy.
xml.info: Fry applauds and hoots. The rest of the crew glare at him.
xml.speak: Let's cut to the chase. There are two kinds of people: sheep and sharks. Anyone who's a sheep is fired. Who's a sheep?
Uh excuse me? Which is the one people like to hug?

Gutsy question, you're a shark. Sharks are winners and they don't look back 'cause they don't have necks. Necks are for sheep. I am proud to be the shepherd of this herd of sharks and I am gonna lead you to the top of this industry of...of...
(WHISPERING) Package delivery.
Package delviery? Oh God! Fantastic! Now the first order of business is to blame everything on the guy before me. Professor?
I'll ruin you like I ruined this company.
Terrific. Question number one: What was your overall business plan?
Uh, um, uh business plan, uh, yes. I keep it here - right next to my heart.
xml.info: He opens a drawer and pulls out a file next to a jar with a heart in it. He hands the file to That Guy.
xml.speak: This isn't a business plan, it's an escape plan.
So long suckers!
xml.info: He climbs down a ladder and runs across the hangar floor laughing insanely.
xml.speak: Fry, as a fellow 80's dollar jockey, I'm making you my new vice chairman.
xml.info: Fry cheers.
xml.speak: I'm rollin' up the corporate ramp.
Ohh!
It's the end of the line!
We're ruined!
What fevered dream is this that bids to tear this company in twain?
xml.info: He leans back and starts reading National Pornographic.
Outside Giorgio Armonster. Exit Fry and That Guy from the shop sporting 80's style suits. The monster waves them off.
xml.speak: Thank you come again!
That's what I call a hostile makeover! Hair gel?
No thanks I make my own.
xml.info: He slicks his hair back.
Ship's Cockpit.
xml.speak: This company's gonna shoot straight to the top and stay there! Like Cindy Lauper! I ask you: Who is the number one delivery service on Earth?
Is it Planet Express master?
xml.info: That Guy laughs.
xml.speak: Is this guy a shark or what? Seriously though we stink out loud. Here's the big enchirito. Mom's Friendly Delivery Company.
We can't compete with Mom! Her company is big, and evil. Ours is small and neutral.
Switzerland is small and neutral. We're more like Germany; ambitious and misunderstood.
Look, everyone wants to be like Germany but do we really have the pure strength of will?
I say we do! Now are we gonna let ourselves be beaten by an old lady?
xml.info: Zoidberg bows.
xml.speak: Yes my liege!
No we're not. And as vice chairman, I believe I speak for the entire board when I issue this challenge to Mom. Look at my butt!
xml.info: He presses it up against the window and cheers.
Cut to: Mom's Office. Mom, Walt, Larry and Igner look out the window.
xml.speak: You call that a pressed ham? Walt, hit the retaliate button.
xml.info: Walt looks at a control panel.
xml.speak: Uh, um, hmm lets see.
Any button they all retaliate!
xml.info: Walt presses a random button.

Cut to: Outside Mom's Building. The sign on the top of the building with Mom bottle-feeding a parcel like a baby suddenly turns eeevil. The bottle turns towards the Planet Express ship and fires lasers at it. The crew scream from inside and the ship flies away.
Madison Cube Garden. Fry and That Guy are sitting in the VIP section with Zapp, Calculon, Morbo and Jackie Anderson watching the big ape fight. The apes fight and scream. Fry hoots.
xml.speak: Woo yeah! Hit him hit him hit him! Now this is the high life! Watching apes mangle each other near celebrities!
In my day we went to coke parties but the principle's the same.
xml.info: An ape screams and throws it's trike at Calculon.
xml.speak: Get your stinkin' trike off me you damn dirty ape.
Listen big guy, now that you're my prod�g�, it's time I cut you in on the secret to success. Any guesses?
Uh, work really really hard?
No.
Oh thank God!
It's all about appearances. That's why its time to update our company's stodgy image and give it the sleek dazzling veneer of the 1980's!
xml.info: Planet Express: Meeting Room. Enter Fry and That Guy on rocket powered chairs. The rest of the crew are asleep at the table. Fry claps and they suddenly wake up.
xml.speak: This company's on the fast track to the It List! Blast back kudos all around!
Uh hello? We haven't made one delivery since you two took over.
Delivery has nothing to do with the delivery business. Image people, image! Scope out this new ad!
xml.info: He presses a button on the remote and an advert comes on the big screen. A Planet Express-ified version of Apple's 1984 ad. A woman runs into a building with a Planet Express package. Mom is on a huge screen.
xml.speak: ON AD We are all one. With one mind, one purpose and one act. Our enemy shall be eaten by scorpions! We shall bow down and worship to ourselves. We shall prevail!
xml.info: The package hits the screen and it explodes. A man in the audience stands up.
xml.speak: ON AD Hey! We were watching that!
xml.info: The scene freezes and a new Planet Express logo appears on the screen � la the FedEx logo only this time it's PlanEx.
xml.speak: That was terrible! People won't even know what we do.
I don't even know what we do. Nah just kidding, what are like a bus or something?
Did you approve that awful ad Fry?
Yes I did Leels! And I'll tell you why. Because it grows the brand.
xml.info: That Guy pats his shoulder.
xml.speak: Oh Lord!
xml.info: Zoidberg growls.
xml.speak: This company's circling the drain I tell you. I'd sell my stock right now for a sangwich!
Sold!
xml.info: He gets a sandwich out of a Miami Vice lunchbox and hands it to Zoidberg.
xml.speak: A complete sangwich? You got fleeced! I would have settled for a hard roll with ketchup inside!
xml.info: Mom's Office. She runs on a running machine while looking at Mentor magazine and Prot�g� magazine. That Guy and Fry are on each cover.
xml.speak: What is this moose drip? The new delivery kings? I'm sick of hearing about those turtle squirts!
But they're kings mommy!
Jam a bastard in it you crap!
xml.info: She slaps them.
Elzar's Fine Cuisine: Private Dining Room. That Guy and Fry are seated in a cosy little room.
xml.speak: Enjoy our private dining room folks! This is where we serve our richest most successful chumps!
Tonight, that's us!
What have you got that's really overpriced?
Everything.
Bring me that.
Make it two. And a glass of all your water.
xml.info: Elzar leaves and That guy pulls out some card from his jacket.
xml.speak: OK, lets work on your execu-speak. I'm worried about "blank."
Don't you worry about "blank" let me worry about "blank."
Very good. I also would have accepted "Blank? Blank?! you're not looking at the big picture!"
xml.info: Mom coughs from behind Fry and he and That Guy look up.
xml.speak: (WEAKLY) What a pleasant surprise!
Shut up booger blaster! It's time the three of us had a talk.
I'll handle this Fry. You get back to the farm, shift some paradigms, revolutionise outside the box.
I'm on it. But if you need me you know where I'll be.
xml.info: He walks through a door to the wine cellar and falls down the steps.
Planet Express: Fry's Office. Fry irons his tie.
Enter Leela, Bender, Hermes, Zoidberg, Amy, Scruffy and Farnsworth.
xml.speak: Fry we're worried about Planet Express.
Don't you worry about Planet Express. Let me worry about blank!
That Guy is nothing but a flashy con man! And you've been hypnotised by his swinging blogney!
You've changed Fry.
What? I haven't changed. Suz? Have I changed?
ON INTERCOM No sir Mr Fry.
Thanks doll.
I don't care what Ms Johnson says, Thst Guy's turning this place into some kind of...business.
This isn't a business, I've always thought of it as more of a source of cheap labour. Like a family.
You're right Professor. We might not be a traditional family like the Murphy's next door or the lesbian coven across the street but we are a family, and That Guy understands that.
xml.info: That Guy appears on a screen.
xml.speak: ON SCREEN Everyone's fired and we're out of business.
xml.info: Everyone gasps.
xml.speak: Oh no.
How?
ON SCREEN I'm gonna sell Planet Express to Mom so she can gut the company and eliminate us as competitors.
ON SCREEN Don't let the door hit you on your way out. 'Cause I don't want ass prints on my new door!
xml.info: The screen cuts out and the ex-crew glare at Fry. He presses the launch button on his chair and it takes off, struggles, and crashes down again. Everyone glares harder. Fry presses the intercom.
xml.speak: Uh Ms Johnson? Please bring in some more chair fuel.
xml.info: Planet Express: Locker Area. Everyone clears out their lockers.
xml.speak: I had no idea the company would be sold. I was just an innocent suck up. You've gotta believe me!
xml.info: Leela slams her door shut.
xml.speak: Just leave us alone and let us clear out our lockers.
Yeah.
xml.info: He slams Hermes' door shut and chuckles. Amy clears out her locker and puts her stuff in a box a man is holding for her.
xml.speak: (CRYING) It's so sad, where will I go? What will I do?
You have Mrs Darlinghaven's cotillion at 7 ma'am.
(CRYING) Oh. That'll be fun.
xml.info: Planet Express: Fry's Office. Fry sighs and presses the intercom button.
xml.speak: Ms Johnson, you've never lied to me. Am I still a good person?
ON INTERCOM I don't know sir. I'm a program built into the intercom.
I've got to redeem myself. Somehow, sometime, for some reason. I'll block this takeover!
ON INTERCOM Mr Fry, your 2 o'clock magician is here.
Believe it or not, I have more important things to do today than laugh and clap my hands. Reschedule.
xml.info: The Planet Express ship flies towards the Intergalactic Stock Exchange and the huge Momcorp ship follows.
Cut to: Intergalactic Stock Exchange. People and robots shout, buying and selling stock.
xml.speak: Sell 100 soylent beans!
Buy 1000 cornbellies!
200 cans of whoop-ass!
Three big bags of trash!
xml.info: Everything goes silent and a huge holographic head appears in the middle of the room.
xml.speak: -EL Attention please. The takeover of PlanEx Corp by Mom's Friendly Company will take place in the business centre in 10 minutes. I am Jor-El! Master of scheduling!
xml.info: Intergalactic Stock Exchange Business Centre. Hundreds of people fill the room. The Planet Express employees sit angrily next to Mom's sons.
xml.speak: OK, we've got the hot tub hot, the wine cooler's cool. It's Hammer time!
xml.info: The Planet Express employees boo him.
xml.speak: You suck!
xml.info: Mom takes the stand.
xml.speak: According to regulations, both companies must approve the takeover. Planet Express shareholders, cast your votes.
Great Bonda of Uganda! We can vote against it!
xml.info: Everyone cheers.
xml.speak: I'll vote it down like a raise for school teachers!
xml.info: They all vote No and a chart ppears behind That Guy and Mom. 49% have voted for No. That Guy votes Yes and the graph changes to 51% for Yes. Planet Express gasps.
xml.speak: What the?
How the?
Oh no.
I neglected to mention that the shares I bought from Dr Zoidberg gave me majority control.
Zoidberg owned 51% of the company?
The shares were worthless and he kept asking for toilet paper.
And now if Momcorp shareholders will cast their ballots.
xml.info: She selects Yes and the Momcorp vote goes up to 99.7% Yes. Walt votes Yes and it changes to 99.8%. Larry votes and it changes to 99.9%. Igner has a little trouble.
xml.speak: Um...uh... Uh, the ballot was confusing.
How about a hand recount?
OK. Ow!
The takeover of Planet Express is approved.
xml.info: The Planet Express crew boos.
xml.speak: This stinks!
Madam is outraged.
Security, I want that bunch of rowdies out of here.
xml.info: The securitybots lift the crew out of their seats.
xml.speak: Hold on a minute!
Hey! Hey!
xml.info: The securitybots take the crew away leaving only a sleeping Farnsworth and Hattie in their seats.
xml.speak: Momcorp will now purchase all outstanding shares of Planet Express at the current market price which is...
xml.info: On the screen behind her PLNX 107 appears.
Cut to: Outside Business Centre. The securitybots drop the crew onto the floor.
xml.speak: Ow! And also it hurt my feelings!
They are? Oh my God! I'm a millionaire! Suddenly I have an opinion about that capital gains tax!
Yeah all right!
I'm even richer!
Oh! I have no shares! Wait! My sangwich! Has it also appreciated in value? Please oh please!
You didn't even refrigerate it you spineless lobster!
You had to drag spines into this!
xml.info: He cries. Fry appears on the overhead monitors. He clears his throat.
xml.speak: ON SCREEN As vice chairman of Planet Express I'd like to say a few words. There comes a time for every man who becomes rich and deserts his friends, when he goes back how it was. For me, that time is now....
xml.info: Cut to: Intergalactic Stock Exchange Business Centre. Fry turns to That Guy.
xml.speak: ...So I ask you, as a friend, won't you stop this deal?
Fry I'm an 80's guy. Friendship means to me that for two bucks I'd beat you with a pool cue 'til you got detached retinas. The deal will go ahead as - My bones!
xml.info: The crowd gasps.
xml.speak: Oh my God! His boneitis!
I was so busy being an 80's guy, I forgot to cure it. My only regret is...that I have...boneitis!
xml.info: He stops twisting.
xml.speak: He's dead.
xml.info: The crowd gasps.
xml.speak: Pry out his fillings, feed him to the jackals and lets get on with the sale.
I don't think so. 'Cause as vice chairman of the company I gain voting control of his shares.
Don't be a fool you idiot!

I'll be whatever I wanna do! That Guy was the greatest businessman that ever lived and before his mysterious death he taught me everything he knew. But some things I had to learn myself. I learned that money is fine but in the end what counts is people... ...People you love... ...You can't put a price on that... So I'm giving up control of the company... ...to a man of enourmous experience... ...Professor... ...Hubert Farnsworth.
xml.info: Farnsworth is still asleep but is now wearing a sleeping cap and bunny slippers. He wakes up.
xml.speak: Oh uh what? I'm awake, I'm awake!
xml.info: The stock price goes haywire. Tape falls from the ceiling an the Planet Express crew slide down on it.
xml.speak: Fry, stop doing the right thing you jerk!
Let Mom buy the company! We all wanna be filthy stinking rich!
Trust me two out of three doesn't cut it!
You mean you'd rather be rich than work together?
Hell yeah!
In my whole life this company was the only place I ever really felt at home. If being millionaires is more important to you than our...
It is!
...friendship, then I'll sell Planet Express, for you.
Millionaires nothing! The stock's only worth three kajiggers!
xml.info: The crew mumble.
xml.speak: Oh come on!
My Jah! It's worth less now than when it was worthless!
It is? Yahoo! We're poor no matter what I do! The deal is off!
xml.info: He selects no and the Planet Express vote changes to 100% for No.
xml.speak: Aha! Once again the conservative sangwich-heavy portfolio pays off for the hungry investor! Oh! I'm ruined. Why? Why?
Look, so we're not millionaires. At least we all still get to work together!
Shut your fat mouth!
xml.info: The crew walk out muttering.
xml.speak: (SHOUTING) See you guys Monday!
xml.info: THE END
